convictions_policy.document: Common Standards for Licensing Hackney Carriage and Private Hire Drivers in Gloucestershire

general_principles.starting_point: Recent serious offences normally preclude licensing
general_principles.rehabilitation: Passage of time and evidence of reform considered

notification_requirement.failure_to_notify: Serious breach - may result in revocation

typical_time_periods.note: These are guidelines - each case assessed individually
typical_time_periods.manslaughter: Minimum 15 years from completion of sentence
typical_time_periods.serious_violence: Minimum 10 years from completion of sentence
typical_time_periods.sexual_offences: Minimum 10-15 years depending on seriousness, many never granted
typical_time_periods.dishonesty: Minimum 7 years from completion of sentence
typical_time_periods.drugs_supply: Minimum 10 years from completion of sentence
typical_time_periods.drink_drive: Minimum 7 years from completion of sentence
typical_time_periods.violent_disorder: Minimum 10 years from completion of sentence

penalty_points_system.separate_from_conviction_policy: Council operates penalty points for breaches of licence conditions
penalty_points_system.accumulation: 12 points in 12 months - automatic referral to committee
examples: Failing to notify conviction within 48 hours

fit_and_proper_person_test.legal_basis: Common law test - not defined in statute
fit_and_proper_person_test.applies_to: All drivers, vehicle proprietors, and operators
fit_and_proper_person_test.test_question: Without any prejudice, and based on the information before you, would you allow a person for whom you care, regardless of their condition, to travel alone in a vehicle driven by this person at any time of day or night?
fit_and_proper_person_test.burden_of_proof: Balance of probabilities (civil standard, not criminal)
fit_and_proper_person_test.applicant_burden: Applicant must satisfy council they are fit and proper

considerations.policy: Common Standards for Licensing sets out conviction policy
key_offences: Driving offences - relevant to competence and safety
considerations.time_periods: Policy sets minimum time periods before licence may be granted
considerations.each_case: Each case considered on individual merits

considerations.threshold: More than 3 current points requires careful consideration
considerations.serious: Driving bans, dangerous driving, drink/drug driving

considerations.relevance: False information on application is extremely serious
Driving with passengers requires higher medical standard
considerations.conditions: Diabetes, heart conditions, epilepsy, sight - carefully assessed

considerations.nr3_database: National Register shows refusals/revocations by any UK authority
considerations.pattern: Pattern of complaints or breaches indicates concerns

decision_making.delegated_authority: Licensing officers have delegated power for straightforward cases
decision_making.committee_referral: Complex cases referred to Licensing Sub-Committee

ongoing_requirement.not_one_time: Must remain fit and proper throughout licence period
ongoing_requirement.continuous_duty: Duty to notify of any changes affecting fitness

fee_setting_authority.principle: Fees must recover reasonable costs - cannot make profit
fee_setting_authority.review: Fees reviewed annually as part of budget process

fees_and_charges.non_refundable: Application fees not refundable if application refused

hackney_carriage_fares.application: Hackney carriages only - private hire fares not regulated

tariff_structure.cannot_exceed: Cannot charge more than meter shows
tariff_structure.can_charge_less: Can agree lower fare with passenger
tariff_structure.tariff_card: Must display current tariff card in vehicle

typical_tariff_elements.soiling_charge: £75 for cleaning if passenger soils vehicle

hackney_carriage_fares.christmas_rates: Higher tariff typically applies Christmas/New Year period

pre_agreed_fares.when: Journey starting outside Gloucester where no tariff applies
pre_agreed_fares.must_not_exceed: If no fare agreed, cannot exceed what Gloucester tariff would be

lawful_basis.criminal_records: Substantial public interest (prevention and detection of crime, safeguarding)

routine_sharing.purpose: Prevent unsuitable persons being licensed elsewhere

safeguarding_sharing.legal_basis: Legal obligation to safeguard and vital interests

retention_periods.note: Retention in line with council's corporate retention schedule and Information Commissioner guidance

individual_rights.right_of_access: Request copy of personal data held - Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)
individual_rights.right_to_erasure: Limited - licensing data held for statutory purpose
individual_rights.right_to_restrict: Can request restriction in certain circumstances
individual_rights.right_to_object: Can object to processing based on legitimate interest

hackney_carriages.what_law_requires: Local authorities must license hackney carriages and their drivers
key_provisions: Section 37: No person to act as hackney carriage driver without licence
Section 40: Power to grant hackney carriage driver licences
Section 47: Proprietors must obtain vehicle licence
Section 68: Power to make bye-laws for hackney carriages

private_hire.what_law_requires: District councils may adopt Part II to license private hire vehicles, drivers, and operators
private_hire.adoption_status: Gloucester City Council has adopted Part II

Suspension and revocation of vehicle licences
Suspension and revocation of driver licences including immediate suspension powers for public safety
Suspension and revocation of operator licences
Taximeters on private hire vehicles (not mandatory but if fitted must be approved)
